intro: Ruellia haenkeana f. lutea, commonly known as the yellow ruellia, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
